page.title: 12HOME LIFE (CONTINUED)
page.content: A{MOBILE LIBRARY}CALLS AT{HONILEY TWICE A WEEK. TWO IRONMONGERS CALL ON THIS BASIS. A BUTCHER CALLS ONCE A WEEK AS DOES A BAKER WHO ALSO SELLS GROCERIES. MOST PEOPLE USE THEIR OWN TRANSPORT BUT THERE ARE FOUR BUSES A WEEK SERVING THE VILLAGE. TWO TRAVEL TO {WARWICK}AND TWO TO{SOLIHULL.}THEY LEAVE AT 9.0AM AND RETURN AT MIDDAY. YOUNG CHILDREN IN THE VILLAGE, FROM 5 TO 11YRS, ATTEND{WROXALL SCHOOL}WHERE THERE ARE APPROXIMATELY 28 CHILDREN IN TWO CLASSES. THE CLASSES CONSIST OF 11 OR 12 INFANTS AND THE REMAINDER ARE JUNIORS. AT 11YRS CHILDREN WHO PASS THE 11+ EXAMINATION GO TO{STRATFORD {GRAMMAR SCHOOL.}THOSE WHO DO NOT PASS GO TO{HENLEY IN ARDEN COMPREHENSIVE {SCHOOL OR TO SCHOOLS IN WARWICK, {LEAMINGTON OR KENILWORTH. SOME {CHILDREN ENTER PRIVATE EDUCATION.
